ObjDetObj * gObjDetObj
 

Detailed Description

This section has a list of all the internal defines which are a part of the DPC.

Macro Definition Documentation

#define DPC_OBJDET_AZIMUTH_STATIC_HEAT_MAP_BYTE_ALIGNMENT
Value:
(MAX(DPU_AOAPROCHWA_AZIMUTH_STATIC_HEAT_MAP_BYTE_ALIGNMENT, \
sizeof(int16_t)))

Azimuth static heat map alignment is declared by AoA dpu, we size to the max of this and CPU alignment for accessing this as it is exported out as result of processing and so may be accessed by the CPU during post-DPC processing. Note currently the AoA alignment is the same as CPU alignment so this max is redundant but it is more to illustrate the generality of alignments should be done.

Definition at line 148 of file objectdetection.c.

Referenced by DPC_ObjDet_AoAconfig().

#define DPC_OBJDET_CFAR_DET_LIST_BYTE_ALIGNMENT
Value:
(MAX(MAX(DPU_CFARCAPROCHWA_CFAR_DET_LIST_BYTE_ALIGNMENT, \
DPU_AOAPROCHWA_CFAR_DET_LIST_BYTE_ALIGNMENT),\
DPIF_CFAR_DET_LIST_CPU_BYTE_ALIGNMENT))

cfar list alignment is declared by cfar and AoA dpu, for debug purposes we size to the max of these and CPU alignment for accessing cfar list for debug purposes. Note currently the dpu alignments are the same as CPU alignment so these max are redundant but it is more to illustrate the generality of alignments should be done.

Definition at line 119 of file objectdetection.c.

Referenced by DPC_ObjDet_preStartConfig().

#define DPC_OBJDET_DET_MATRIX_DATABUF_BYTE_ALIGNMENT
Value:
(MAX(sizeof(uint16_t), \
DPU_CFARCAPROCHWA_DET_MATRIX_BYTE_ALIGNMENT))

Detection matrix alignment is declared by CFAR dpu, we size to the max of this and CPU alignment for accessing detection matrix it is exported out of DPC in processing result so assume CPU may access it for post-DPC processing. Note currently the CFAR alignment is the same as CPU alignment so this max is redundant but it is more to illustrate the generality of alignments should be done.

Definition at line 111 of file objectdetection.c.

Referenced by DPC_ObjDet_preStartConfig().

#define DPC_OBJDET_DET_OBJ_ELEVATION_ANGLE_BYTE_ALIGNMENT
Value:
(MAX(DPU_AOAPROCHWA_DET_OBJ_ELEVATION_ANGLE_BYTE_ALIGNMENT, \
sizeof(float)))

Elevation angle alignment is declared by AoA dpu, we size to the max of this and CPU alignment for accessing this as it is exported out as result of processing and so may be accessed by the CPU during post-DPC processing. Note currently the AoA alignment is the same as CPU alignment so this max is redundant but it is more to illustrate the generality of alignments should be done.

Definition at line 157 of file objectdetection.c.

Referenced by DPC_ObjDet_AoAconfig().

#define DPC_OBJDET_POINT_CLOUD_CARTESIAN_BYTE_ALIGNMENT
Value:
(MAX(DPU_AOAPROCHWA_POINT_CLOUD_CARTESIAN_BYTE_ALIGNMENT, \
DPIF_POINT_CLOUD_CARTESIAN_CPU_BYTE_ALIGNMENT))

Point cloud cartesian alignment is declared by AoA dpu, we size to the max of this and CPU alignment for accessing this as it is exported out as result of processing and so may be accessed by the CPU during post-DPC processing. Note currently the AoA alignment is the same as CPU alignment so this max is redundant but it is more to illustrate the generality of alignments should be done.

Definition at line 130 of file objectdetection.c.

Referenced by DPC_ObjDet_AoAconfig().

#define DPC_OBJDET_POINT_CLOUD_SIDE_INFO_BYTE_ALIGNMENT
Value:
(MAX(DPU_AOAPROCHWA_POINT_CLOUD_SIDE_INFO_BYTE_ALIGNMENT, \
DPIF_POINT_CLOUD_SIDE_INFO_CPU_BYTE_ALIGNMENT))

Point cloud side info alignment is declared by AoA dpu, we size to the max of this and CPU alignment for accessing this as it is exported out as result of processing and so may be accessed by the CPU during post-DPC processing. Note currently the AoA alignment is the same as CPU alignment so this max is redundant but it is more to illustrate the generality of alignments should be done.

Definition at line 139 of file objectdetection.c.

Referenced by DPC_ObjDet_AoAconfig().

#define DPC_OBJDET_RADAR_CUBE_DATABUF_BYTE_ALIGNMENT   (sizeof(int16_t))

Radar cube data buffer alignment in bytes. No DPU module specifying alignment need (through a #define) implies that no alignment is needed i.e 1 byte alignment. But we do the natural data type alignment which is 2 bytes (as radar cube is complex16-bit type) because radar cube is exported out of DPC in processing result so assume CPU may access it for post-DPC processing.

Definition at line 102 of file objectdetection.c.

Referenced by DPC_ObjDet_preStartConfig().

Variable Documentation

ObjDetObj* gObjDetObj

This is supplied at command line when application builds this file. This file is owned by the application and contains all resource partitioning, an application may include more than one DPC and also use resources outside of DPCs. The resource definitions used by this object detection DPC are prefixed by DPC_OBJDET_

Definition at line 93 of file objectdetection.c.
